inn1.comm: back of a length to start off, pushed onto the pads and Taylor looks to flick. Can't get bat on it though.
better line, holds the length short of the driving area, Taylor crouches and moves across to cover the line.
the first signs of movement, Mills always gets the ball to swerve away, but very good pace off the track, comes onto the bat nicely and Taylor drives to mid off
slips this one too far down the leg side, and Zimbabwe open their account with a wide
nice timing again from Taylor, but he again finds a fielder. Short of a length outside off, Taylor stays beside the line and cracks it into the covers
'Wait on!', yells Taylor after staying on the crease and playing softly towards point
very good start from Mills barring the wide. Taylor moves across and hangs back to defend a back of length delivery into the off side
good start from Southee, lands the first one back of a length along off stump. Not much feet movement from Coventry, just opens the face and defends to point
Southee sprays it down the leg side now. Another wide.

direct hit from mid on, and Coventry is in trouble. Fuller delivery from Southee, moving away from middle and off, Coventry gets half forward and drives without much timing to mid-on. Bennett does reall well, charging forward, swooping on the ball and under-arming into the sticks at the bowler's end. Coventry was not running full-tilt. He wasn't stretching fully. He's caught short by half a foot or so.
again Southee searches for that big away swing, but too ambitiout. He sprays it onto Taylor's pads, and Taylor skips inside the line to glance daintily along to fine leg. First runs off the bat.
a better judged single. Taylor taps softly off the pads to midwicket and they hustle across. Taibu will make most singles, however tight they are. He's the new man in.
angling into middle and leg from short of a length, Taibu blocks to the leg side

decent finish to the over from Southee, just focusing on the McGrath region of doubt, back of a length on and around off stump. Taibu stands upright and times the defensive push down the ground pretty well. Fielded by mid off
curl in the air for Mills. Comes in from wide of the crease, and straightens in the air and goes through outside off stump. Good leave from Taylor
short of a length and a foot outside off, Taylor hangs back and deflects backward of point for a single
Taibu comes half across and then decides to leave as Mills bustles through outside off stump and lively pace

attacks the stumps this time, and Taibu shows Coventry how the quick single is to be done. Played softly towards mid on, Vettori runs in from midwicket and intercepts, but doesn't even throw. Taibu is a whir of fast moving legs as he scoots in.
back of a length outside off stump, defended solidly to the off side
Taylor gets another single, hanging back in the crease and working Mills with the angle towards midwicket.
too straight from Southee, ends up on Taylor's pads and he tucks him straight to midwicket
short of a length again, just outside off and Taylor drops it with soft hands to the off side

138.6 kph, but poor direction from Southee. Nice touch from Taylor, he stays on the crease, gets nicely inside the line to tuck it to the right of square leg and to the left of deep fine leg for a couple of easy runs.
fuller length on off stump, Taylor is confidently forward to defend down the track

ooh, played with such soft hands that it nearly spun back towards the furniture. Back of a length in line with off stump, Taylor defends and then looks back in alarm as the ball heads close to the stumps. No damage done.
ends with one short of driving length and angling into Taylor who defends solidly down the track.

glorious from Taibu. There hasn't been much to drive, but once Mills over-pitched Taibu was gleefully ready. Leans that front foot across to the pitch of the pall and drills it through the line, to the left of extra cover.
Mills wisely holds the length back and gets it to angle into Taibu who soulders arms
similar length, but straighter, Taibu pushes forward and defends down the track
fuller length this time, angling in from wide of the stumps at 133.6 kph, Taibu carefully defends.
full again outside off, Taibu's timing them alright. Straight to cover this time
another single stolen to the on side, Taibu gets one on the pads and dabs softly towards mid on for one
length ball, Southee gets it to angle in, in a Millsy manner, and Taibu punches into the covers
this time Southee is too straight, again, and Taibu gets a single to mid on

wait, wait, what's that? Hope the people at Pepsi are watching. This is not the Sehwag Upar Cut. it is not the Dilshan Pallu scoop. Our man, Venkat Raghav names it the 'Perpendicular cut'. This is what happened: Brendan saw a short ball, thought he had room to play the upper cut, and arched back, while angling the bat face. And then he noticed it coming in sharply, cramping him for room. What does Brendan do? He arches further back, and the ball is actually where his head was when he took stance. He then plays the upper cut. And gets it down to fine leg. Go figure!
length ball on off stump, defended into the off side. Jeez, three balls have been bowled in the time it took me to describe that delight!
Brendan lets this one go outside off.
ohh, a tight run thing that. Brendan gets away with it, dropped softly to the leg side and he hustles down the track and dives to make his ground.
back of a length outside off, Brendan opens the face and dabs it to short third man for one

lovely stuff from Mills. He's been getting them to curve away for the most part, but this time he nips one back in off the seam. Taibu realised very late that it was coming in, and had to cover the gap between bat and pad in a hurry. The ball snuck through, but missed the stumps.

whoa, Nathan, leave the beamers for when you are bowling! Taibu puches to mid off with pristine timing and makes his ground. Nathan McCullium throws it straight at his head, Taibu ducks and it then hits the stumps at the striker's end.

Brendan may be in trouble now. Lbw appeal turned down, and refered. Landed on off stump, short of a length and then came in off the seam, Brendan was guilty of looking to play around the pads, and he missed. Hits in line, but replays say it was barely clipping the top of middle and leg. That is going to save him. Umpire Erasmus sticks to his original verdict.
good shot, Mills gives him enough width outside off to get beside the line and use the wrists to steer between point and third man for a couple
lets the last one go through outside off, phew! Eventful couple of overs, those
short of a length at 135 kph and cutting in off the seam, solid defence from Taibu.
Taibu chips out of the crease early, Southee probably saw him and landed this even shorter of driving length. Taibu had to defend into the off side

you will see a lot of New Zealand cricket, and very rarely see Vettori drop a catch. A sitter at that. Taibu has been itching to go for the booming drive, gets one just short of the slot and goes through with the shot. He could not get enough on that to get over Vettori's head, and the captain at mid-off crouched low and looked to pouch it. In and out.

Southee probably doesn't have to wait long for redemption. Zimbabwe have refered an lbw appeal that was upheld. Southee gets this one to bend in with the angle, from back of a length around off stump. Taibu tries to work it towards the onside after moving the front foot into line, and almost falls over as he looks to play around the pads. It slips past the bat and thuds into the foam. Looks hopelessly adjacent. Taibu never wanted to refer that, but went through on Brendan's insistence. Zimbabwe have wasted a review.
lively stuff from Southee, clocks at 129 kph but angles across the new man nicely, and he plays inside the line
Ervine gets bat on this one, opening the face and steering it backward of square
Brendan potters across the crease and nudges with the angle backward of midwicket for one
Ervine is not very sure of his off stump yet. Mills again hits that seam and gets it to move away from the batsman who plods half forward and prods half certainly
and again, not getting a good enough stride across, and not staying put on leg stump either. This one carries nicely from back of a length, past his waft and into the keeper's gloves
fuller length, Ervine covers the line this time and defends from the off stump line
length ball again, beautiful rhythm from these guys so far, Ervine reaches across and defends with an opened face to the off side
defends from a length to the off side and Mills maintains his metronomic accuracy (bah, what a cliche!)
Southee whistles in with the offcutter, Brendan gets half forward to cover the line and defends from the crease
good delivery again, Southee nips another one in off the crease and Brendan plays from the crease. Inside edge trickles away backward of square for a single
damn good bouncer that. 131 kph, but it was all about the angle and the line. Ervine had to weave away to keep his head intact. He did so, just in time.
Ervine's search for the off stump continues. Gets another one angling past him innocuously and he pokes unsurely with an angled face. Lands short of slip, and they get a single.
Brendan gets across to cover the line outside off stump and defend a length ball into the off side
ends with a fuller delivery, Brendan chooses not to drive. Ten overs of intense and accurate stuff from Mills and Southee. Impressive from NZ.
full and angling across Ervine who strides across and drives confidently into the covers
back of a length around off stump, Ervine hangs back and drops it to the off side

edgy, but Ervine will take it. He's again not entirely across to the pitch of the ball and just leans into the drive. You can get away with it if you are Ganguly. On this occasion, Ervine gets away with it. Uppishly steered, but safely into the gap square on the off side
lesser width this time, Ervine covers the line better and check-drives to the off side

there you go, Ervine again drives airily, and nearly dumps it straight to Franklin at short cover. He gets a half stride across and pops it in the air. Zimbabwe will want him to keep it down, like the Motera crowd so far.
better feet this time, Ervine gets across and drives along the ground to cover
banged in back of a length at 131 kph and coming into the body, Brendan drops it backward of square for one
short of a length and angling across Ervine, he hangs on the back foot and steers with an angled face through point
Brendan sneaks a single towards backward point, stays back and defends, it runs off bat onto body and away behind square. Ervine hares across in time.
opens the face and steers backward of square.
Ervine lets one go outside off as Bennett whistles past at decent pace
opens the face and dabs into the off side, but can't get the single away.
oh my, what does Ervine do? He tries to plough through the leg side. He decides on the shot a year before the ball is delivered, just jumps out and swipes across the line. And he misses.
more conventional, he angles the bat and steers into the off side
fuller length and again going away from Ervine who dabs with an opened face into the covers

persistence and the law of averages pay off for Ervine. He's played a pleasing cover drive and managed to find a rare gap in the covers. Length ball, angling across him, so the invitation was there. Ervine reached across to the pitch and just drilled through the line. Solid piece of timing.
defensive this time, plays without the intention to score into the covers.

and Ervine has perished to the cordon. The odds of finding these gaps are not very high, and Ervine pays the price for hitting in the air again. Short ball, just outside off, a delivery that deserved to be cut, but not with this field. Ervine cracks it off the middle and it flies straight to Ryder at backward point. Easily pouched. Zim are stuttering.

Elton in trouble, he may be run out without facing a ball. Third umpire takes a took at it, but Elton has dived into safety. Brendan potters across to off stump and dabs straight to point. Elton invokes his inner Usain Bolt and charges down like a hare on steroids. He then puts in the full length dive to beat NZ's best fielder - Guptill - who under-armed a throw onto the stumps. Just in. Green.
short ball first up to Elton, weaves out of harm's way in time.
short delivery, hits the spot back of a length and thuds it into Elton's bat and he drops it to the off side for one
back of a length to Brendan, he moves across to off stump and defends to the off side
Bennett sprays it onto the pads, Brendan can't connect with the flick, but gets a leg bye
attempted yorker, comes in from wide of the crease and jams past the attempted squirt, into the toes. They take another single.

Captain gets captain first ball. Or has he? Elton reviews a potentially controversial lbw decision. Tossed up on middle, back of a length and it straightens. Here's the catch - Elton has charged a mile out of his crease. Ok, may be not a mile, but 2.5 metres for sure. The replays say it pitched on the line of the stumps, hit in front of middle as Elton misses the chip to the leg side. The potentially questionable predictive powers of Hawk-Eye (since he was well out of the crease) say it was hitting leg stump. It is back to umpire Erasmus, and he, like Billy Bowden the other day, sticks to his decision. Only, this time, it is out.
floated up slowly around off stump, he comes forward and defends

this is turning into a nightmare for Zimbabwe, as if all the troubles were not enough, Rosco pulls off a blinder now, Dan gets Chakabva to reach outside off and go for the drive, the edge flies to the right of Taylor at slip, who puts out his right hand quickly and takes it cleanly, Dan has struck twice in his opening over
flatter outside off stump and left alone
pushes this one out in to the leg side and searches for the single, but the non-striker is not interested
tossed up a bit more now outside off stump, and he leaves wisely, not much turn for Dan but lots of bounce, double-wicket maiden to start off
he bowls it fuller around off stump, and he comes out to drive it wide of mid off
Bennett gets this one to bounce sharply outside off stump, and it is wisely left alone
hustles out and looks to work this one away with the angle for a run on the leg side, but finds midwicket
more full stuff from Bennett, driven out towards mid on off the front foot
full delivery solidly driven wide of mid off, who puts in the dive to his right, but fails to stop it cleanly, and lets a single through
gets one full on the pads, and flicks it wristily through midwicket, Dan gives chase all the way to the boundary, and pulls it back just inside with a dive, super work
whoa, comes down the track, takes this one on the full, and flicks it against the turn just over a leaping midwicket, its timed well enough to roll away in to the ropes
Vettori keeps it full, and he pushes it back down the track
loud appeal for leg before, he was pushing forward, it was the one that darted straight in, but struck him high on the pads, Vettori thinks about the review but decides against it
goes down on a knee and swipes it across the line, he is taking on Dan in this over, and gets it wide of deep square leg
drops it a touch short, and he goes back to work it away backward of square
this one hurries through straight on after pitching on a length outside off, he shaped up for the cut, but was beaten, it was too close for that shot
shot! makes full use of the overpitched delivery, gets a foot out, bends the knee, and hammers it past extra cover, picture-perfect, holds the pose too
142.4 kph full one targetting the stumps, he was a bit late on it but got behind the line in the end to push solidly to mid off
same pace, similar delivery on the stumps, this time the push is in front of mid on, goes slower off the bat, and that gives them time for a run
shuffles across and uses the angle to work this one away to midwicket
now he shortens the length a bit, it comes in with the angle around off stump, he goes back and blocks
goes wider outside off stump this time, he takes a step out and shoulders arms
short and wide outside off stump, cut away towards sweeper cover
flighted full on leg stump, driven straight down to mid on
lunges to sweep this one way down the leg side, one hand comes off the bat, and short fine leg tidies up
gets another full one on leg, and drives it past midwicket for a couple
Dan goes leg stump again, he takes it on the pads as he comes forward to turn it in to the leg side
just a tad shorter, he instantly goes back and punches it to long off for the single
starts off on a length on leg stump, is worked away backward of square
back of a length on middle, or the Styris length, he shuffled to turn it away to deep midwicket
Lamb gets a boundary, Scott bowls it full on leg stump, he just stands tall and lifts it over the infield, deep midwicket had no chance
now he turns this one past square leg, gentle stuff to work around
another darts in on leg stump, this time he misses out on the flick, and it rolls away off the pads
Scott has been consistently straying on leg stump this over, another one is glanced down to fine leg
tossed up full on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
sliding with the angle down leg, worked away backward of square leg, too much leg stumpish stuff at the moment
clipped away through midwicket, again working it away with the angle
and another one, this time wide of long on, you would think the singles would be harder to come with half the side back in the hut
played out to midwicket off the back foot
slowly tossed up in the air, again on leg stump, he comes forward and turns it away through square leg
back of a length outside off stump, he cuts hard but straight to backward point
right of the middle of the bat this one, flicked away but midwicket is in the way
waits for this short of a length ball to come on to him, and guides it down to third man
on the leg stump, turned away wide of fine leg, New Zealand are all over with the line at the moment
this one is on off stump, and gently turned away to midwicket
steals a single in front of mid off, taps and runs, easily done
Dan on the leg stump, ho hum, turned wide of midwicket with neat timing
gets forward to this full one on middle and leg and finds midwicket with the drive
full outside off now, and he gets the foot out and pings long off with the drive
tossed up slowly, he lets it come on and turns it to midwicket
gets a full toss now, and eases it down to long on
comes forward and wants to drive it to long off but Dan gets to his left quickly and cuts it off

Scott strikes, out of nowhere, nippy full offcutter from Styris, Taylor was taken completely by surprise, can't blame him after all those gentle trundlers Scott served up before this one, he wafts across the line as this one darts in on the toes, Styris gets the decision in his favour instantly, no reviews left for Zimbabwe anyways
gets one back of a length and strides out to defend
shuffles across and pushes this one back down the track from off stump
played out in to the off side off the front foot
goes full again, not as much as the one that got Taylor, and that allows him to come forward and defend
looking to be full again, but cannot get it right, he strides forward and drives with a flourish down to long on
Dan with the theatrical appeal now, got him to dart out to a full ball, and he looked to heave it , was struck on the pads, umpire Erasmus is not interested
the quicker one, hurries on with the angle, just gets bat on it in time
turned away to midwicket off the back foot
bowls it outside off stump now, and he reaches out to push it away to extra cover
tight stuff on the stumps, he is right forward in defence
just a bit short and flatter outside off stump, he goes back and cuts it away to backward point
punched away to mid off, goes quickly to him, no chance of a single
very full on the stumps, he stands tall and pushes it back to Scott
takes a step out and drives this full delivery down to long on, precious singles, precious few of them
bat and pad close together as he comes out and blocks to short extra cover
goes back of a length, he goes deep in the crease and blocks again
now he gets one on leg stump, and utilises the freedom to work it away wide of deep square leg
goes back to a fuller one, and takes it from off stump to jab it away towards point
now he pushes out to mid off, Dan keeping them on a leash, not that hard if they are six down
dances down the track, but his drive finds midwicket
yet another dot ball from Dan, Zimbabwe going nowhere
defends this one in to the off side

and this is really the last thing Zimbabwe wanted, really is, what a shame, it was guided towards backward point, Lamb wanted the single very badly, he was more than half way towards Utseya when he turned him back, no chance he was to make it back, the throw came in flat to Dan, who was in front of the stumps, and removed the bails in a diving motion, even as Lamb's dive was in vain
goes back of a length, and it is punched away off the back foot
left alone outside off stump
strikes him on the pads with a fuller one, that one was going down leg, Southee's vociferous appeal cannot change that fact
pacy delivery coming in with the angle around off stump, forced away off the back foot, goes towards short third man
Southee's intentions are clear, targetting the stumps with a full length, this time Cremer gets some bat on it to dig it away
137 kph on a length this time, he comes forward and blocks it solidly in to the off side
blocked away in to the off side off the front foot
drops it a bit short now, and he rocks back to cut it away past cover
the one that goes straight on, hits him on the pads as he misses the waft, but that was down the leg side
and again, struck on the pads, this time as he attempts to go forward in defence, but again going down leg
looks to guide this past point, but it hurries on to him around off, and he stabs it away in the end
goes back and looks to hammer this one away down the ground, gets it only as far as mid off
coming in with the angle around off from short of a length, blocked away calmly
digs it in short outside off, he stays in the crease and steers it in the air down to third man
Southee gets this one to come in from a length, he wanted to pull, went for the shot, but was beaten by both pace and movement
looks to angle it in to the pads from a length, does that too, but no use if it pitches outside leg
this one goes across the batsman from a length, and Cremer meets it with a broad defensive bat
full on the off stump, he gets the drive off the middle of the bat, and it is pulled back just inside the ropes
almost yorks him with a tossed up delivery, hastily dug out to the bowler
defended off the front foot and the ball rolls away in to the off side
guided towards point off the back foot
endeavours forward in defence, the inside edge earns him a single in front of square leg, its the end that matters, not the means
this one is on the pads, and easily worked away backward of square leg
plonks the front foot out and gets behind the line of a flighted ball to defend
and is greeted with a fearsome cut that flies in the gap between cover and point, he got some width and went very hard at the ball
whoops, this one was back of a length coming back in to the batsman, he thought about a pull but weaved away at the last moment, and the bat made a half-arc
now he gets a good short delivery in to the body, and pulls it away in the air over square leg
too much leg side from Bennett, if anything NZ have been guilty with that line today, worked away to fine leg
much better line, short of a length outside off stump, he goes across and defends off the back foot
goes for the surprise yorker, and almost surprises the batsman, who gets the bat in front of pad just in time to get an inside edge backward of square leg
flighted on the stumps, he stretches out to smother it
shortish and hurrying on around off stump, eased away to short extra cover off the back foot
gets him to drive uppishly from off stump, but it eludes the infield to roll away to sweeper cover
gets him to hurry in to a defensive prod from the crease
floated up slowly this time on the stumps, he goes forward to block
very full from Dan around leg stump, he goes down on a knee for the sweep, off the middle of the bat but there is a man at deep square leg
goes for a pull to a short one down the leg side, and misses it totally
gets this one to hurry past the outside edge, he came forward and pushed way inside the line
138 kph back of a length ball thuds in to the bat as he blocks off the back foot
138.9 kph now, this one too goes on sharply with the angle outside off stump, he pulls his bat out of harm's way in the end
for the umpteenth time this over, Bennett goes past the outside edge, get him to go for a booming drive outside off stump, and he missed again
goes for the pacy yorker, but it does not come alright, he uses the pace and flicks it away past midwicket
shuffles across the work this shortish one away wide of midwicket
goes back of a length around off stump, and he pushes it away on the off side
looks to flick this one on the pads away through midwicket, guides it straight to that man
more back of a length stuff from Mills, it is pushed out towards extra cover
goes hard at this one outside off stump off the back foot, but still cannot beat the infield, it is point this time
gets one full enough on the pads to be flicked away in front of square leg, there is a big gap on the boundary there
worked away off the back foot wide of midwicket
full on the off stump, it is pushed to mid off, and they take on Nathan who fires in the throw and misses the stumps, but hits Utseya
gets forward and across and plays this one with the angle towards mid on
107.2 kph slower shortish one, he had shaped up for the pull, stood frozen for some time before swatting it off the inside edge wide of fine leg
short delivery again, but down the leg side, ho hum, pulled away backward of square leg, one hand comes off the bat handle as he does so
they are using his pace and his angle cleverly here, another short of  a length delivery goes towards deep square leg as he shuffles outside the line and works it away
goes forward in search of the single down the ground but pushes this full one back to Mills
two feet outside off stump from a length, comfortably guided away to third man, these two have survived for almost ten overs now
tries the pacy yorker, but he digs it out down the track
more room outside off stump, and it is cut away past a diving point and third man has to work hard to cut it off
stands in the crease and jabs this length ball away
Mills gets him finally, it was closer to off stump this time, much fuller too, he went for the drive, and got a healthy outside edge through to the keeper
uses his feet to get to the pitch of the flighted ball, and push it on the off side
lovely delivery, the one that goes straight on, he was pushing inside the line expecting some turn, there was none, Brendon collects
down the track and drives down the ground to long on
another one that angles past the right hander, he was going forward and had no clue about it
another one, where was Nathan hiding till now, this one too goes past the edge as he plays for non-existent turn
pushed away to point off the front foot, Price is away
looks to go for the pull shot, but too much pace on the bouncer from Mills
shuffles across and works this one away to square leg
Price flirts with danger, goes for a slash to a short and not quite wide delivery, Bennett goes diving forward at third man, and it just falls short of him, just
way outside off stump, Utseya goes poking at it, had to really stretch out to get to it, and it rushed past the edge
fuller now on the middle and leg line, he pushes it towards mid on
Utseya goes feeling outside way off stump again, again he cannot get bat to ball, Brendon collects
goes forward and drives this one wide of Dan at mid off
right forward in defence to a flighted one
takes some hopeful steps down the track but can only push it back to the bowler
this time his hope holds promise and brings him some runs as he lifts a tossed up one high over midwicket and in to the gap, wide long on goes wider to cut it off
turned towards square leg for one
takes a step out to a fuller one and plays it out towards extra cover, they think about a single for a second, no harm in thinking
length ball on the stumps, driven past the bowler
close to off stump, he stays beside the line and finds third man with the guide
lovely work from Guptill at backward point, it was pushed out wide of him, and he put in the dive and even got the throw back to Jesse in time, but the batsmen are safely home
driven down the ground past Jesse
played out in to the off side, pretty harmless stuff at the moment
goes for the punch off the back foot to one outside off stump, and is beaten
full on the stumps, played with the turn down to long on
Nathan fails to stop this forceful drive, and Zimbabwe steal a single
gets a leading edge that goes in the air but wide of extra cover
turned away backward of square leg, Brendon goes ball fetching
bowling too quick and flat is Nathan, this one is flicked away off the pads
nicely done, came down the track, got outside the line, and lifted this tossed up delivery with the turn wide of Bennett at deep midwicket
looks for the full delivery right away, this one homes in on off stump, patted away in to the on side
shuffles across and works away this shortish one backward of square leg
Utseya throws his bat at this length ball outside off stump, and bashes it past the bowler straight down the ground for a boundary
turned in to the leg side for a single
guided to third man for a another single
goes wide down the leg side with a short of a length ball
goes forward and guides this one wide of third man
follows the batsman who had backed away down the leg side with a full delivery, and it rolls away on the on side
gets forward and meets this one with a solid push, and steals a single as mid off cannot pick it cleanly
looks to heave this one away in to oblivion, but the inside edge ensures it does not get farther than midwicket
hit away down to long on this time

lovely drive from Utseys, he made a bit of room, Jesse helped by bowling it wide outside off stump, and he opened the face of the blade to drive it past a diving extra cover, and wide of sweeper cover as well
cannot do much with this one around off, and pats it away

Southee bellows and pleads at the same time, and gets the decision he wanted, it was full and came in to strike him on the pads, he was nowhere near it with the bat, and that would have taken out leg stump, one more to go
this time Southee goes still fuller, he pushed half-forward hopefully, Southee thinks it is pad first, maybe there was a bit of bat involved as well, too close to tell, Panyangara lives on
the yorker down the leg side, he had backed away a shade, and brought down the bat in time to dig it out on the off side
perfect forward defence from the No 11, comes out confidently and blocks defiantly
now Southee gives him the bouncer, and he goes down on it quickly

more forward defence from Panyangara, Southee again thinks there could be pad first on it, the umpire does not, Vettori goes for the review, but apparently he was a bit late in going for it, and umpire Erasmus does not allow him to
goes down on a knee in front of off stump, and decides to go for the scoop shot, but the ball was not full enough, and he made a feeble attempt in the end, but missed
lunges out and taps this one away in front of cover for a single
short and wide, guided away off the back foot to point
well, well, Panyangara makes some room outside leg stump, and swats a length delivery high over mid on, it's Powerplay of course
that's the way to avoid them, goes down on a knee, drops the wrists and the bounce sails miles above him
gets an inside edge as he goes forward to a length ball outside off stump
sees one in the channel outside off stump, and tries to play the reverse paddle, not anywhere close to the ball

that will do, Southee homes in on full on leg stump, and Utseya's swing across the line cannot prevent it from crashing in to the base of the wood, Southee sees the ball has done the job, and turns back in an everyday matter-of-fact way

inn2.comm: back of a length at 121 kph and steady lift outside off, Guptill shoulders arms

and NZ are away. Tinashe is known to be accurate, or so says Liam Brickhill, our Zimbabwe expert. That wasn't very accurate, on the pads and clipped gleefully to deep backward square leg. Fine leg dived full length and went over the ball. Chakabva it was.
better, more like Liam's prediction. Back of a length and holding its line outside off, Guptill leaves
closer to off stump, he gets it to gently come if from outside off. Guptill defends to the off side

Whoa, Guptill is in a hurry. Length ball on middle and leg, the kind of ball you give respect when you have just come in. Try convincing Guptill. He just plonks the front foot down and tees off. Cleaner than a whistle that, and it sails over long on.

an entirely forgettable first over from Zimbabwe. Over-pitches the final delivery on leg stump. Guptill's just smashed a decent ball for six, so in balance, he's been charitable in getting just four off this poor ball. Drills it straight back for four.
tossed up on off, Brendon leans out and defends
back of a length and coming in around off stump, Brendon hangs back and forces into the off side
another flattie on middle and leg, Brendon rocks back and forces it to long on for one more
Guptill turns the strike, fast and flat from Price again, on the pads and punched to wide mid on
finally some flight, Brendon leans out and smothers the spin
quicker and slightly shorter length, straightens from off stump, and Brendon defends compactly
Guptill is just not going to let him bowl. Length ball outside off, Guptill just flows through the line despite not getting to the length, and carves over the covers for a couple
slower ball, wise decision to mix it up, Guptill covers the line and dinks it backward of point for one

appeal for lbw, seemed optimistic from the outset. Hint of inward nip from outside off, Brendon was pushing outside the line of off, and he was well forward too. Seemed to rap him outside the line of off, so that's safe.
tails into the pads this time, Brendon flicks a little airily, but straight to midwicket. Is the pitch slowing up?
in some sense, Tinashe is bowling to his field. Dropped on the pads, Brendon tickles it fine, straight to the man at leg gully
haven't seen Brendon play so many dots in a while. Gets behind the line of a short of length delivery around off stump and defends to the off side
speared into the pads, Guptill presses forward and defends
similar ball, fractionally shorter, allowing Guptill to press back and punch to long on
flight to Brendon, and spin from the line of leg. He's delivering them from wide of the crease and getting them to straighten. Calmly defended down the track
aha, here comes the armer, Brendon backed away for the cut, and clearly did not spot it. He just managed to bring the bat down at the last moment.,
this one strays onto the pads and is worked carefully to midwicket for one
strays on the pads again, and Guptill misses out, flicking straight to backward square leg. Tight start from Price.
Tinashe lands one more on leg stump and is worked square for a single
dangles this one well wide outside off, and Guptill resists the temptation to flail
good lines now from Tinashe, keeping it outside off and short of driving length. Guptill punches it into the covers

Guptill has tonked this one out of Ahmedabad. He's generating inexplicable timing with these clean, minimalist swings. 94 metres this one has travelled horizontally, and it went a mile vertically. Another one from Tinashe angling into the pads, Guptill comes across and lofts it through the line and it lands well behind long on.
corrects the line, lands this one outside off and Guptill steers to point
ends with a slowish full delivery, Guptill drives solidly down the ground for one
Price straightens one from leg stump, Guptill defends back to the bowler
rocks back this time and punches to mid off
Price does a Raina, stops in his action, becomes a statue literally, before deciding to release the ball. Guptill doesn't move much, and forces it wide of mid on for a single
Brendon defends from the crease, nothing to hit from Price

Brendon plays the reverse sweep and picks up four. The gall these batsmen have, to lap them all the way across from wide of leg stump! Price fired this one at some pace too, and Brendon just slapped it down to the unmanned third man boundary
fired in even faster to end the over, half an appeal for lbw as Brendon pushes forward
tossed up and drifting into the middle and leg area, puched back down the track and fielded by Utseya
too much width, and he gets away with it as Guptill cracks the cut straight to point
leans out to a tossed up delivery outside off and drives compactly, straight to mid off
this one holds its line, Guptill did not pick it and got an outside edge as he reached out to drive. Safe, though.
again, Guptill presses forward and drives with some authority, but straight to cover
nicely done, opens the face and steers his drive squarer rather than straight and gets it through the point region for a couple
Brendon calmly turns the strike with a solid drive down the ground
drifts into Guptill's pads, and he carefully dabs it to the leg side
holds the length back and gets it to drift into the pads again, tucked cautiously to the leg side
leans out and drives carefully into the off side this time.
Guptill gets one past that fielder, turning the wrists to flick a single
Brendon is really cautious here. Reaches out, gets the bat in line, adjusts for the spin and dead bats
speared onto the pads, Guptill presses forward to the line of the ball and drives to mid on
straighter this time, Guptill again defends off the front foot
holds the length back, Guptill covers the line again and blocks
he hints at coming down the track, can't get to the pitch and defends down the pitch
reaches out well across to the pitch of the ball and flicks through mid on. Finally a single
Brendon steals a single off the leading edge, looks to turn him from outside off to the leg side and closes the face too early. He runs even as the ball dribbles out to mid off.
tossed up on off, Brendon leans out and defends down the track
as always the second one is flatter, Brendon stays back and defends down the track
looks to get inside the line and get a single to the leg side, but can't get it past the bowler
this time he does it, skipping inside the line and working off the pads through square leg
flat and straight on leg stump, defended solidly down the track
flighted on off stump, Guptill opens the face and steers it square.
tossed up and a push into the covers.
fuller, Brendon leans out and plays it back down the track
and again, loopy delivery outside off, Brendon leans out to smother the turn
short of a length and turning in from outside off, Brendon hangs back and steers against the spin through backward point for a couple
this one turns into the pads and Brendon flicks, but can't get the gap
tossed up to end the over, Brendon reaches out and works it back to the bowler
boundary after a long time, Guptill plays back to one turning away and gets an outside edge. "Where is the slip!", asks Liam im frustration. Well, they have evaporated.
tossed up on the stumps, Guptill presses out of the crease and defends down the track
drifts into the pads here, Guptill on-drives and turns the strike over

finally, Brendon plays the way Brendon can. He jumps out of the crease, creating room to play through the off side as he does, and gets a tossed up ball turning away, allowing him to go inside out over extra cover. Neatly done.
this one turns away from the stumps and he pokes it out to the off side
armer ends on the pads, and Brendon flicks square for a single
dropped short and wide of the stumps, Brendon plays with undue caution and guides to covers
whoa, Prosper is bowling on a different plane. Literally. That's slipped out and gone over Brendon's head.
this one lands. Brendon presses forward to the pitch and plays to the off side
Brendon leaps out of the crease and drives with the spin through long on for one
turns slowly into the pads and is tapped with the spin to square leg
floater, fired in faster and it holds its line around middle stump, Brendon pushes it back off the back foot
this one ends on middle and leg, allowing Brendon to bunt through midwicket for a single
Price slowly loops one down the leg side and Brendon gets a glance fine enough to turn the strike
turns away from off stump, Guptill opens the face and works it to the off side
armer hurries into middle and leg, Guptill is forward and defends compactly with bat and pad together
reaches out to a delivery that wasn't there for the drive but reads the trajectory to play it back to the bowler
on the pads, Guptill works it to square leg and hustles a quick single
on Brendon's pads to end the over and he dinks it to square leg. No single this time, it went too fast to the bowler
another easy single from Guptill, works one from the pads towards midwicket
Brendon jumps out to the pitch and drives solidly through mid on for one more
Guptill ondrives straight to midwicket and can't get a single
on the pads, flicks it with the spin to the right of midwicket for one

Brendon must be good at golf, going by that shot. Skips out in the line of leg stump, Utseya obliges by flighting one well outside off and Brendon just lofts him straight over long off. Smooth and easy.
drift inwards and some turn, Brendon is early on the turn to the leg side and it pops up to the right of the pitch. Safe though, NZ are running away to a win here.
tossed up and spinning in, Guptill leans out to defend
turns into the pads this time, worked with the spin to the leg side
fired in faster on middle and off, it is played back to the bowler
he presses forward and drives against the spin this time, to the right of extra cover for a single
grip and turn into Brendon's pads, he smartly works it off the hips between short fine leg and backward square leg for a couple
again Brendon jumps inside the line and flicks to the leg side for one more
full toss on Brendon's pads, clipped gingerly to the deep for a single
easy for Guptill, leans out and drives against the spin through covers for one
drifts in and turns but ends on off stump, Brendon looks to nurdle with the spin and finds midwicket
this time Prosper goes straighter, and Brendon gets the single square
Guptill gets another single with a dink to square leg. Losing count of these singles now. Zimbabwe looking as flat as they did while batting.
leans out to the pitch outside off and smothers the spin cautiously to end the over
flat ball turning in from outside off, punched down the track off the back foot
this one slides too far down the leg. Must have been close to a wide, since the replays dont indicate Brendon getting anything on it
Brendon stays in the crease and forces a short ball into the covers
reaches out to a tossed up delivery that holds its line, but Brendon manages to play it back down the track
reaches out to the pitch and eases it against the spin into the off side
Brendon leans out to the pitch and whips solidly through square leg for a single
full toss on the pads, Brendon chips it to deep midwicket for an easy single
Guptill reaches out to the spin and plays with an angled face into the off side
tossed up on middle and off and turning away, played straight to backward point
on leg stump this time and defended down the track without any fuss
another dot ball, as Guptill reaches out to guide a full ball to the off side
over-pitched outside off and Guptill unleashes a stinging drive that could have broken Prosper's hands. He is some pain after fielding the shot at cover.
short ball turning into the pads, punched down the ground to long on for one
tossed up outside off, Guptill leans out to cover the line and defends down the track
this one turns lesser, and Guptill opens the face to dab it straight to point
turning down the leg side, worked compactly off the pads to the leg side for one
turning down the leg side, Brendon stays back and whips through square leg. This is easier than easy now for NZ.
flighted on off stump, Guptill covers the line and smothers the spin. Not much of it on offer, anyway.

now that Dilshan has taken the copyright for the scoop shot, Brendon seems to want to make the reverse sweep all his own. Plays it as well as anyone else in the world. This one is tossed up around leg stump, he reverses the grip, twists the wrists and goes with the spin through third man
skips out, Cremer surprises him with a full toss and Brendon slaps it with one hand to long on for one
Guptill reaches to the spin and drives smoothly into the covers for another single
on Brendon's pads, clipped through midwicket for one more
turns away sharply from outside off as Guptill shapes to drive. Outside edge, goes safely to third man for two
tossed generously up, driven back to the bowler. This game is turning into an afternoon stroll in Ahmedabad.
flat delivery turning in from outside off, Guptill punches into the covers to reach a fifty. He started in a hurry and has then slowed down to ensure he filled his boots to the brim.
Brendon leans out and works it off the pads, straight to backward square leg
turns into Brendon's pads, he tucks it square for a single

whoa, that must have been close. Will Zimbabwe refer it? Umpire Aleem Dar has turned down the lbw appeal, and they are reviewing it. Tossed up outside off and turning into the batsman, Guptill tries to flick from the line of off stump, without getting to the pitch. It turned in sharply and hit him in front of middle. No inside edge there. However, Hawk-Eye says that was going well down the leg side. Guptill is safe.
stays in the crease and calmly drives back down the ground
another huge appeal turned down, this time he was hit in front of off, but big spin again. Not reviewed.
flighted by Cremer, Brendon leans out and guides the drive into the off side
tossed up on the pads, tapped quietly to midwicket for a single
well, not Zimbabwe's day this. Flighted well outside off, and sharp turn away from Guptill. He was clearly fixed by it and ended up getting an outside edge through third man for four
flatter and turning from leg stump, Guptill presses back and clips through midwicket for the 100th run
Brendon survives a huge lbw appeal now. Not reviewed too. Full dlivery on off stump I reckon, Brendon goes for the sweep and misses. Where did it hit him? Replays awaited.
tossed up outside off to end the over, defended into the off side.
he spears his first ball well down the leg side and will have to rebowl it
this is what Guptill has been waiting for. Pace on the ball. Elton delivers a friendly half-colley outside off and he crunches it off the front foot to the cover boundary.
back of a length and slanting down the leg side, Guptill nurdles to fine leg for four more
angled into leg stump, driven solidly down to long on for one
over-pitched on the stumps again, nothing bowling this from Elton, Guptill drills it down the ground for one more
Brendon leaps out of the crease and looks for a booming drive, but it is short of a length outside off and is cracked into the covers
fuller ball on off stump, Brendon drives without much timing into the covers
tossed up and turning away, driven with the spin into covers.
drifts onto the pads, nurdled without a fuss through square leg for one
short ball, Brendon will feel disappointed he could not get four. Cut away hard, straight to point
leans out this time, gets to the pitch and drives with the spin to mid off
on middle and leg, short of a length and turned away square for a single
looped up generously on the pads, Guptill dinks it to square leg for one more. He retains strike.
another one slants in amiably onto Guptill's pads and is driven down to long on for one
whoa, Brendon skips out of the crease and gets a short of length ball angling into the body. He whips it with furious timing, and nearly holes out to the man at deep backward square leg.
fuller delivery on Guptill's stumps, punched solidly to long on for one more
vintage McCullum. He's gone to fifty with a typical flick drive down the ground. No feet movement, no nothing, just jumped into position and scythed it down the ground
he's taking guard outside the crease now, and gets a full ball on the lg stump to drive to long on for one more
fuller ball to Guptill to end the over, he gets another single down the ground.
short ball, breaking away from off stump and carved into the covers for one
Brendon's making up for lost time. Charges out again, gets to the pitch and creams it in cavalier fashion, inside out, through long off.
slower in the air, turning away from the batsman and Brendon steers with an angled face to backward point
hmm, Cremer hurries him into the pull shot with a flipper, Brendon just got the bat down in time as he went for an ill-advised pull
tossed up on leg stump, Guptill tries to turn it away and gets a leading edge to covers
tossed up on off stump, defended compactly into the off side again
short of a length outside off, steered carefully to Cremer at point. Fumble allows an easy single
full length ball outside off, driven without any problems to long off for one more
Brendon turns it over with another single down the ground.
back of a length, and driven solidly back down the track by Guptill. Hits the stumps at the bowler's end, but Elton did not get a finger on it. Brendon might have been out if he had.
mistimes the chip as he looks to clear the off side, it went off the lower half of the bat and landed short of deep extra cover.
short of a length and angling into the body, worked straight to midwicket
gentle turn away from Guptill who steers without a problem through covers for one
tossed up on leg stump, played back down the track off the front foot
flighted on leg stump, Brendon rushes out of the crease and dumps Cremer straight back down the ground for four. He's getting into menacing form here. Other teams, beware.
hangs back in the crease and whips through the leg side for a single
Guptill does likewise, flicking through midwicket for one more
armer on the stumps to end the over, Brendon is quick enough to adjust and steer to point
length ball on the stumps, carefully driven to mid on for one more
Brendon skips inside the line and drives to extra cover. Tinashe has over-stepped and Guptill will be winding up.
he's wound up, swung, and missed. Slow yorker from Tinashe, Guptill did not pick it clearly, and lost his grip as he swung without control
he's whacked this perfectly back down the track. Too perfectly. Hits the stumps and costs him a boundary.
cuts in off the track and Guptill punches straight to that new fielder
this time he moves his toes away and turns the wrists carefully to get a single wide of mid on
the last ball tails into Brendon's leg stump and he winkles a single off the hips through square leg
flighted on leg stump, driven back to the bowler
Brendon skates out of the crease again, gets to the pitch and looks to whack over long off. Can't quite loft this one well enough, gets a single to the deep
flatter on Guptill's pads, worked to the leg side for one
flighted on the pads, Brendon goes for the sweep and gets it away to deep backward square leg
short all outside off, sits up like a dolly and is cut away fiercely to the deep for a single.
tossed up on the pads, swept without a problem to the deep for a single

the Amdavadi vendors sitting outside the stadium, watch out. A projectile may be headed your way. Length ball from Tinashe on off stump, certainly not the worst he's bowled today. Brendon flexes those tattooed biceps as he whacks the leather off the ball and sends it almost into orbit. It lands in the midwicket stands. Soon one may land beyond the stands.
fuller ball on off stump, punched down to long on for one
Guptill tries to steer him from back of a length through the off side and finds the fielder
inducker, traps Guptill on the pads as he tries to whip it square. Stifled appeal, seemed closer than that appeal merited.
Guptill gets under a length ball and thumps it on the bounce to long on for a single
ends with a dot ball, Brendon defends. For a change.
flighted on leg stump, drilled down to long on for a single
short ball, turning into the pads, Brendon clips it square for a single to square leg.
short ball outside off stump, and Guptill opens up a small lead in the top-scoring stakes, cutting nicely behind point and in front of short third man for a single.
works this one off the pads to midwicket. Can't get the single
and again, hangs back and nudges with the spin to midwicket
Guptill does a perfect over gaaji [taking a single to retain strike off the last ball]. Stays back and dinks a single down the ground. One to win.
back of a length outside off, he opens the face and steers to the off side softly
Tinashe bowls a bouncer. A little late in the piece, I should say. Guptill ducks.

Guptill has finished it off in style. The Kiwis have tamed the Eagles today in Ahmedabad. Emphatically. Tinashe delivers a friendly length ball on the pads and Guptill gets under it and bashes on the up, almost all the way. Lands a foot inside the long on fence and runs over the ropes. All over.
